de.intarsys.security.smartcard.pcsc

Interface IPCSCConnection

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    PCSCConnection

    public interface IPCSCConnection
    The iconified PC/SC connection. The methods are mapped directly to the repsective PC/SC API functions. This is created by IPCSCContext.connect(String, int, int).

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void beginTransaction()
      Start a new transaction.

      Disconnect this connection.
      void endTransaction(int mode)
      End the current transaction.

      • controlMapped

        byte[] controlMapped(int controlCode,
                   byte[] inBuffer,
                   int inBufferOffset,
                   int inBufferLength,
                   int outBufferSize)
                     throws PCSCException
        Send a control code, mapped to fit the current platform where PC/SC is running. This is needed as PC/SC control codes vary between windows and PCSC Lite.
        Parameters:
        controlCode -
        inBuffer -
        inBufferOffset -
        inBufferLength -
        outBufferSize -
        Returns:
        Throws:
        PCSCException

      • disconnect

        void disconnect(int mode)
                throws PCSCException
        Disconnect this connection. It is not valid to use this connection from now.
        Parameters:
        mode -
        Throws:
        PCSCException

      • getStatus

        void getStatus()
               throws PCSCException
        Dummy "no op" call. This is used as a keep alive currently only as Windows PC/SC resource manager will kill the resource after some idle time.
        Throws:
        PCSCException

      • transmit

        byte[] transmit(byte[] bytes,
              int i,
              int length,
              int receiveLength,
              boolean sensitiveContent)
                throws PCSCException
        Send bytes to the card. In extension to the PC/SC API we introduce a flag if the content sent to the card may be logged to some device. The default implementation can log all communication.
        Parameters:
        bytes -
        i -
        length -
        receiveLength -
        sensitiveContent -
        Returns:
        Throws:
        PCSCException
